intro: Schoenoplectiella juncoides var. rockii, commonly known as the Rock Rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its upright, grass-like foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an important species in its native habitats.
